# sentry_monitor (Resource)

Sentry Cron Monitor resource. This resource manages monitors used by the Crons product.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "sentry_monitor" "main" {
  organization = sentry_project.main.organization
  project      = sentry_project.main.id
  name         = "nightly-db-backup"

  schedule_crontab = "0 2 * * *"
  timezone         = "UTC"
  checkin_margin = 5
  max_runtime    = 60

  failure_issue_threshold = 2
  recovery_threshold      = 1
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the monitor.
- `organization` (String) Organization slug or ID.
- `project` (String) Project slug or ID.

### Optional

- `checkin_margin` (Number) Minutes after the expected check-in before the run is considered missed.
- `failure_issue_threshold` (Number) Consecutive failed or missed check-ins before creating an issue.
- `max_runtime` (Number) Maximum runtime in minutes before an in-progress check-in times out.
- `owner` (String) Owner actor in the format `user:<id>` or `team:<id>`.
- `recovery_threshold` (Number) Consecutive successful check-ins before resolving an issue.
- `schedule_crontab` (String) Crontab schedule expression.
- `schedule_interval` (Attributes) Interval schedule. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--schedule_interval))
- `slug` (String) Unique monitor slug. If omitted, Sentry derives one from `name`.
- `timezone` (String) IANA timezone for crontab schedules.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedatt--schedule_interval"></a>
### Nested Schema for `schedule_interval`

Required:

- `unit` (String) Interval unit. One of `year`, `month`, `week`, `day`, `hour`, `minute`.
- `value` (Number) Interval value.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# import using the organization and project slugs, and monitor id or slug:
# https://sentry.io/organizations/[org-slug]/crons/[project-slug]/[monitor-slug]/
terraform import sentry_monitor.main org-slug/project-slug/monitor-id-or-slug
```
